turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: This the book your writing?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: It's just a work in progress, kinda rough.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: This guy killed a mess of people.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Henry Lucas.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Henry Lee Lucas. Well he was only convicted of killing eleven but he claimed to have killed over three hundred.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Wonder what all them people done made him so mad?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: How did he get away with it for so long anyhow?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: He almost always killed strangers. Spent years moving on from one place to another. That made it real hard to track him down.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: That bad?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: ...Then some.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: ...They never caught that Black Dolya Killer, huh?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Dahlia, no.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Now why is that?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Some people think it's because he never killed again. He just disappeared back into society.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: You don't sound too convinced 'bout that?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I always thought it was the work of a serial killer. Anyone who took that much time and care bisecting another human being must have been enjoying it and would have done it again. And again. Until someone stopped him.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: That your... "theory", ain't that what they call it?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: You wanna hear mine?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Ain't you goin' to record it?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: By the way, I'm not much of a pool player.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Shit, it ain't hard to play pool. I can teach you everything ya need ta know.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Hell yeah! I'll even spot ya a few points first game.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Wait a minute. You're gonna hustle me?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Nah... how much money have you got?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: ...Well I probably drunk more than my share, anyway... you go on an' have it.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: No, it's all yours. It's on me... for saving my ass back there.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: ...Well then, that's how many I killed.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: If you say so.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Damn right I do.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Ya see what I'm sayin'?  Ha!

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Hey... Ain't we getting near the next murder site... Bri?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Forget about it, doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Hell it don't...  ...Hand me Brian's map there Adele. One day I'm gonna pass some store and see your book in the window. Me and Adele gonna buy a copy for our coffee table.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: So tell me... what happened here?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Two brothers, prospectors, lived here. Up until a few years back.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: ...and?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: They picked up hitchhikers... young men... and brought them back here.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: You two been busy in here.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: What happened to Adele?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Well, let's put it this way.  I need me a new woman.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Executing the killer wouldn't bring my mother back.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Thank god!

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Okay, now you want to talk about good versus evil? Well then let's start with Adam and Eve and the snake.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Who do I have to blow to get out of here?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: A... I gotta go.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Tonight turned out to be pretty interesting.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: The party?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: The warehouse. I'm not that drunk.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: It was definitely the high point of the evening.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Just being there where it really happened. It was different... more visceral.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Mmm... I love it when you talk like that.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I thought you wanted to be a writer.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: ...I do.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Then you can write anywhere. Let's get out of here, while we still can.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Carrie, come on... we can leave anytime we...

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: No we can't. We can never leave once you start talking about tenure... and vacation pay... and parking privileges and... oh shit! let's just go to California now, right now, before it's too late.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: ...just like that?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Just like that. Load up the Lincoln... point it West... stop when we hit the fucking ocean.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Hey. I didn't have the heart to wake you.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Thanks. What are you doing?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Well, I sat down with my tapes and your photographs, which are great by the way... and I started writing.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: So how's it going?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: ...I think it's the best stuff I've done.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: ...and I think I know why.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Because I was there. And for a moment that night I understood how she came to pull the trigger.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: This mean your finally going to finish your thesis?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Look, fuck the thesis. I think there's a book here. Your photographs and my research, together.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: A book on the warehouse murders?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: A book on some of the most infamous murderers in America. I want to go to where they lived and where they killed and I want you to photograph it.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: What I'm thinking is, we can drop down through Tennessee, across Arkansas and into Texas, from there it's a straight shot into California.  "We don't stop... until we hit the fucking ocean."

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: It's about fucking time, Kessler! I'd just about given up on you.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: We don't have enough money, but we'll figure something out.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: What did he sound like on the phone?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Real polite. Kept calling me 'sir.'

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I like that.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I still think we should have met them first.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Beggars can't be choosers. They were the only ones who answered the ride share note, remember?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Oh, yeah... He had a real thick accent right outta "Deliverance."  "Still? Who said anything about a still? Get ya ass up in them woods!"

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Funny, very funny.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Jesus... They've probably got five bucks between them. Turn around.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Lighten up...

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: We could have been in and out of there in less than ten minutes...

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Hey, I got some great stuff... it's okay.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: You mean because I object to having somebody take off their shoe and scratch their foot while I'm eating I'm prejudiced?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: He can't help the way he was raised. I kinda feel sorry for him.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Feel sorry for him? Obviously you didn't get a whiff of that sock?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Bitch, bitch, bitch!

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Up yours.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I heard that.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: ...And all I'm saying is I think we ought to try and get along with them. That's all.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: You try, I'm gonna pretend they're with somebody else.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Carrie.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: All set?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Fuck!

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Take your time.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Who said he's my good buddy?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: You sure been acting like you were...  ...Out whoopin' it up, a drankin' and ever' thang.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Yeah, and you should've seen how terrified she was that he'd find out. He beats her.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: How do you know that?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: She told me...  ...but only when she "deserves" it. Did you know he was in jail?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Stop being so fucking melodramatic! If it was murder he'd still be locked up or on parole, in which case he wouldn't be allowed to leave the state.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Maybe he wasn't allowed to leave! Geezus Brian!

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Look again!

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: A copy of a tape they found. He recorded everything.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: There's more...

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I'm finished.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I'm scared. A week ago you would never have even thought to pick up that gun. This afternoon you're out there wielding it around like Clyde fucking Barrow, for Christ's sake! What's with you?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Okay, it was a cheap thrill, it was stupid, I admit it, alright?  But let's not blow this. Not now... Let's just get the photos.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I can't believe I agreed to do this.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Oh come on, don't give me that shit... you wanted to take these photos as much as I wanted you too.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Wrong! I was willing to do whatever it took to get you up off your ass and on the way to California... There's a big difference.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Brian I want him out of our car!

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Why, what did he do?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Brian get him out of the car. Next gas station either he leaves or I do!

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Carrie... stop it.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: What the fuck is wrong with you Brian!? If you'll stop taking notes for once and open your eyes... you'll see that he is a homicidal fucking killer. He is... for real!

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Shut up Carrie, please... just shut up!

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: You gotta talk to her. She looks up to you, she'll listen to you.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I tried talking to her at the mine. It didn't work.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Then try again,

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Carrie, watch for Early.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I'm going to try and lift the end of the piano. If I can... slide your cuffs free.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Any word from that gallery?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Nervous?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: ...Apprehensive. Let's not forget these are the people who banned the Mapplethorpe show. Anyway, California's loaded with galleries.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You mean 'Ted Bundy's' finally agreed to leave?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: ...Soon as he finishes his thesis.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Listen, Eric's been "finishing" his for over three years now.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'm sorry, but I just can't see you veggin' out in LA-LA LAND.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Oh, I don't know... I think that once I dye my hair blonde, buy a string bikini and cultivate that tan... I could be veggin' out with the best of 'em...  Like fer shurr!

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Bri'.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Where's Adele?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: She wasn't feeling so good.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: ...Need a hand with those bags?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: No, thanks, I can manage.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Ain't you done enough drinking for tonight?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: ...Brian hurt his foot.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Sometimes... Don't know why it is... I get so hot I can't stand it. I just start sweating like a dog. You ever get like that?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: ...never?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: No, never. Excuse me.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Tell ya Bri., I'm still a little sleepy,... think Adele and me are gonna take us a fiesta.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Siesta.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Early, just think...

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Shut your mouth.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: He's a killer, Brian... He's fucking insane.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Everybody just shut up!

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Darlin' you were 'bout that far from spendin' the night at the morgue. You understand?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: He wasn't going to shoot her, you murdering son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Who d'ya think you're foolin'?  I know you better than you think...

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: ...You're hurting me...

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: You were plenty hot.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: You sick twisted fuck! You don't know shit about me.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: ...You know what I mean?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: ...I know I'd love to smash this bottle right in your fucking face.

turns.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER
turns.text: You're supposed to call me when you lose your job Early. I stopped by the mirror factory today, you left quite a mess behind there.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Wasn't my fault...

turns.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER
turns.text: ...The police were way out of line when they stopped you from beating that bartender half to death. And no doubt God'll be pickin' on you on Judgement Day...

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: I ain't got nothing against God. It's the people he let come into the world... lot of them should have been stopped at the door. What are you looking for?

turns.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER
turns.text: You be at this personnel office, Friday, three o'clock sharp.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER
turns.text: ...Janitor's job.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Oh man... come on, I don't want no janitor job.

turns.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER
turns.text: His Parole Officer.

turns.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
turns.text: Right, I talked to you on the phone. They say it's a torch job, that sound like your boy?

turns.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER
turns.text: Could be.

turns.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
turns.text: Where would we find him?

turns.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER
turns.text: Hell if I know, crazy son of a bitch said he was thinking of moving to Texas.

turns.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
turns.text: Without his car?

turns.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
turns.text: What about the owner of the house...  ...this John Diebold, any idea where he might be?

turns.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER
turns.text: No, but I can tell you he's not gonna be too happy about this.

turns.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER
turns.text: ...Diebold?

turns.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
turns.text: ...That'd be my guess.

turns.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER
turns.text: Looks like somebody cut off his ring finger.

turns.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
turns.text: Well now I'd say that's the least of Mr. Diebold's problems.

turns.speaker: BLACK NURSE
turns.text: How old you?

turns.speaker: BLACK NURSE
turns.text: How many people have you had vaginal intercourse with?

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Umm. Altogether?

turns.speaker: BLACK NURSE
turns.text: Yes. Altogether.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Hmm. I'd say eight, maybe nine.

turns.speaker: BLACK NURSE
turns.text: How many times have you gone unprotected?

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: With four of them, I didn't use any kind of protection. Wait, maybe it was three.

turns.speaker: BLACK NURSE
turns.text: Have you ever had anal intercourse?

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BLACK NURSE
turns.text: With how many people?

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Umm. Three I believe. But I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: BLACK NURSE
turns.text: Were they wearing condoms?

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Uh. Yes. Twice they weren't. Two times they didn't.

turns.speaker: BLACK NURSE
turns.text: Well, girl. You tested negative for all sexually transmitted diseases and infections.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: BLACK NURSE
turns.text: You're clean.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Oh my God. I can't tell you how nervous I've been. I couldn't sleep last night.

turns.speaker: BLACK NURSE
turns.text: Now you gotta be careful.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Was up bitch?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: You fucked it?

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: I knew you fucked it! I sat out here for like two hours! That girl was like twelve, and you hit it up!

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Who am I? Who am I? The mothafuckin' virgin surgeon.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Well, how was it?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Oh my god, so good. That girl can fuck.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: She can fuck?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Hell yeah. That bitch was bleeding. When I first put it in she screamed real loud. I saw her bite down on the pillow.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Oh shit. How long did it take?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Did what take?

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: How long did you fuck her?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Well it took me longer than I thought it would take. It took like 15 minutes to talk her into it. But once it was on, we fucked for a good half an hour. I had to keep taking it out and putting it back in. It hurts the first time.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: But then when she got into it. She really got into it. It was good.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: How did she smell? Did her puss stink?

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Oh man, it smells like butterscotch.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Hell's yeah. She was so clean.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Oh man, that's the best.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: You could tell she took care of herself. She had all these powders and creams in her bathroom.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Let me smell it again.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: You know what else?

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: I can tell that she had just entered puberty.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Well, I was flipping through a picture book of her and her family, right.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: And there was this picture of her painting Easter eggs or something. And I said, you were cute when you were little.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: And she goes, yeah that picture was taken less than a year ago. I look younger without my makeup.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: And I looked at her, and thought to myself Oh my god, this girl is a baby.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: And for a second I felt a little bit guilty. You know, because she's young and all. And then I was like, oh shit, that turns me on. I wanna fuck this little baby girl.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: I'm telling you Casper. I think I'm getting addicted to that shit.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: To what? Virgins?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Yeah. It's like all I think about now. Not just that, it's like lately during sex, I start dreaming about these complex fantasies.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: I mean I'm dreaming about going all out, crazy shit.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: You mean like fucking two virgins at once.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: That would be good. But I mean more like. I don't know. Like when I was having sex with her, I kept thinking how much I would like to put it in her ass. Just to see what would happen.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: She's probably smash you in the fucking face.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: I don't know about that. She was pretty into it. But I wasn't gonna try. The whole thing is, you just gotta take it slow. Show 'em some respect.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Did you tell her that you loved her?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Like. Like. Never love. Love is for low-level virgin seduction guys.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Get another forty.  Smoke a blunt.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Are you hungry?

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Hell yeah. Fuckin' starvin'. Wait up a sec.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: You wanna go to Paul's house?

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: What for? That guys a dick.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: I'm sure he's got food. He's always got those microwave burrito things in his freezer.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: You think he's got any herb?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: I don't know, he quit dealin' but I'll bet he'll smoke us out.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: You think?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Probably.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: He lives on 76th?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: 78th.

turns.speaker: CASPER
turns.text: Den less go Joe.
